intro: Tephrosia richardsiae subsp. erucifera, commonly known as the African cowpea, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its compound leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces pods that contain edible seeds, which are used as a legume in local cuisines. It is also valued for its nitrogen-fixing ability, making it useful in agricultural systems. The subspecies erucifera is distinguished by its specific morphological features, including the shape of its leaves and flowers.
